contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|MK|mK}} '''MK''', '''mk''' or '''mK''' may stand for: {{TOC right}} ==Locations== * [[Magic Kingdom]], a [[Walt Disney World]] theme park in [[Greater Orlando]] * [[Mong Kok]], a area of Hong Kong with the highest population density in the world * [[Milton Keynes]], a town in southern England ** [[MK postcode area]], postal districts in the Milton Keynes area * [[Morris Knolls High School]], a high school in Morris County, New Jersey * MK, the ISO country code for the [[Republic of Macedonia]] ** [[Macedonian language]], ISO 639 digram ** [[.mk]], the Internet country code top-level domain for the Republic of Macedonia * Minimal Kids, a Brighton based movement. * [[Magic Kingdom, Sydney]], a defunct theme park in Australia ==People== * [[M. K. Asante]] (born 1982), American author, filmmaker and professor * [[Maria Kanellis]] (born 1982), American professional wrestling personality * [[Mark Knopfler]] (born 1949), English musician, co-founder of Dire Straits * [[Michael Kors]] (born 1959), American fashion designer * [[Marc Kinchen]], American dance music producer * [[Mary-Kate Olsen]] (born 1986), American actor * [[Majak Kun Biliu]] (born 1978), South Sudanese ==Titles== * MK, abbreviation for [[Machinery Technician]], an enlisted rating in the United States Coast Guard * Mk, a post-nominal title in the Christian church indicating the bearer was a [[monk]] * [[Member of Knesset]] (the legislature of Israel) ==In business== * [[Markup (business)]], a term for the difference between the cost of a good or service and its selling price * MK, the IATA airline designator for [[Air Mauritius]] * [[MK Electric]], an English manufacturer of electrical goods * [[MK Sportscars]], an English sportscar kit manufacturer * Mysore Kirloskar, an Indian manufacturer of lathes, part of the [[Kirloskar Group]] ==In entertainment== * [[MK (channel)]], a South African Afrikaans-language music channel * [[Moon Knight]], Marvel Universe superhero ===Video games=== * ''[[Makai Kingdom: Chronicles of the Sacred Tome]]'', a tactical role-playing game * ''[[Mario Kart]]'', a series of racing video games made by Nintendo featuring characters from the ''Mario'' franchise * [[Meta Knight]], a character from the ''Kirby'' video game series * ''[[Mortal Kombat]]'', a series of fighting video games developed and published by Midway Games, and later Warner Bros * [[Mushroom Kingdom]], the primary setting of the ''Super Mario'' video game series ==In politics== * MK, nickname of [[Umkhonto we Sizwe]] (Spear of the Nation), formerly a paramilitary wing of the African National Congress (ANC) * [[Mebyon Kernow]], a Cornish political party in the United Kingdom * [[Mein Kampf]], a partly autobiographical political treatise written by Adolf Hitler * [[Member of Knesset]] (the legislature of Israel) ==In science and technology== * [[Mark (designation)]], a designation used to identify versions of a product or item * [[Megakelvin]] (MK), an SI unit of temperature * [[Midkine]], a protein * [[Millikelvin]] (mK), an SI unit of temperature * Mk reference point, an interface of the [[IP Multimedia Subsystem]] used to exchange messages between BGCFs in different networks * [[mk (software)]], a make replacement in the Plan 9 from Bell Labs and Inferno operating systems * [[MK spectral classification]], a stellar classification system based on spectral lines ==In sport== * [[FK Mandalskameratene]], a Norwegian football club * [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.]], a football team in Milton Keynes often shortened to MK Dons ==Other== * [[Mitsubishi_GS_platform#Chrysler.2FFiat|Chrysler MK platform]] ([[Jeep Compass]] and [[Jeep Patriot]]) * [[Finnish markka]], the official currency of Finland from 1860 to 2001 * [[Gospel of Mark]], the second book of the New Testament in the Christian Bible * [[Missionary Kids]], the children of missionary parents * [[Morseâ€“Kelley set theory]] in the field of mathematics ==See also== *[[MKULTRA (disambiguation)]] {{disambiguation}}
